definition: posthumous name given to second emperor of a dynasty/King Taejong of Joseon Korea (1367-1422), reigned 1400-1418
highest/greatest/too (much)/very/extremely
school/sect/purpose/model/ancestor/clan/to take as one's model (in academic or artistic work)/classifier for batches, items, cases (medical or legal), reservoirs
surname Zong
Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649

posthumous title of Hung Taiji 皇太極|皇太极 (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor
"Duke Li of Wei Answering Emperor Taizong of Tang", military treatise attributed to Li Jing 李靖[Li3 Jing4] and one of the Seven Military Classics of ancient China 武經七書|武经七书[Wu3 jing1 Qi1 shu1]
pinyin: Tang2 Tai4 zong1 Li3 Wei4 Gong1 Wen4 dui4

definition: King Taejong of Joseon Korea (1367-1422), reigned 1400-1418
Hung Taiji (1592-1643), eighth son of Nurhaci 努爾哈赤|努尔哈赤, reigned 1626-1636 as Second Khan of Later Jin dynasty 後金|后金, then founded the Qing dynasty 大清 and reigned 1636-1643 as Emperor
pinyin: Huang2 tai4 ji2 Qing1 tai4 zong1

sentences.english: Tai Emperor of the Tang Dynasty named the city gate tower "Shangshan" mainly because of religious idea.
sentences.chinese: 宋太宗以“上善”爲城門賜名，主要出於宗教觀念。

sentences.english: In the end the Emperor decided to temporarily stop the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 最終唐太宗決定暫時停止這次出征。

sentences.english: Tang armies under Emperor Tang Taizong was also very powerful.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗領導下的唐朝軍隊也非常強大。

sentences.english: During the reign of Emperor Taizong there was a minister named Wei Zheng.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗執政時期有一位大臣叫魏徵。

sentences.english: TangTai-zong admired Wang's calligraphy very much which consolidated the Wang's respectable position in the calligraphy field.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗推崇王羲之書法，從而奠定了王書的獨尊地位。

sentences.english: In all his life, Buddhism kept a permanent relationship with him.
sentences.chinese: 唐太宗一生，與佛教有着不解的淵源。

sentences.english: I was also 14, when Emperor Taizong called for me. How did you enter the palace?
sentences.chinese: 太宗皇帝召我進宮時，我也十四歲。你是怎麼進的宮？

sentences.english: Lu Mu Gong Mongolia are doing when the prime minister is always based on generous treat people, Taizong very appreciated.
sentences.chinese: 呂文穆公蒙正做宰相時總以寬厚待人，太宗非常賞識。

sentences.english: Next, we'll talk about Wei Zheng, whom Emperor Taizong feared yet respected.
sentences.chinese: 接下來，我們再說那個令唐太宗又敬又畏的魏徵。

sentences.english: Speak unto thee bad or good, emperor overblown the wind and cloud.
sentences.chinese: 太宗說好說歹，停息了這場風雲。

definition: Emperor Taizong of Tang, reign name of second Tang emperor Li Shimin 李世民[Li3 Shi4 min2] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Great Ancestor (posthumous title, e.g. for the founder of a dynasty)

Li Shimin, personal name of second Tang emperor Taizong 唐太宗[Tang2 Tai4 zong1] (599-649), reigned 626-649
Emperor Gaozong of Tang, reign name of third Tang emperor Li Zhi 李治[Li3 Zhi4] (628-683), reigned 649-683
Emperor Gaozu of Tang, reign name of first Tang emperor Li Yuan 李淵|李渊[Li3 Yuan1] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Emperor Taizu of Song, posthumous title of the founding Song emperor Zhao Kuangyin 趙匡胤|赵匡胤 (927-976), reigned from 960
first Sui emperor (541-604) Yang Jian (541-604), reigned 581-604
Li Yuan, personal name of first Tang emperor Gaozu 唐高祖[Tang2 Gao1 zu3] (566-635), reigned 618-626
Daizong, Temple name of seventh Ming emperor Jingtai 景泰[Jing3 tai4]
Ming Chengzu, Temple name of third Ming Emperor Yongle 永樂|永乐[Yong3 le4]
Yingzong, Temple name of sixth and eighth Ming emperor Zhengtong 正統|正统[Zheng4 tong3]
Emperor Xuanzong of Tang (810-859), reign name of seventeenth Tang emperor Li Chen 李忱[Li3 Chen2], reigned 846-859
Wei Zheng (580-643), Tang politician and historian, notorious as a critic, editor of History of the Sui Dynasty 隋書|隋书
Emperor Yang of Sui (569-618), said to have murdered his father and brother to seize the throne, reigned 604-618
Sejong the Great or Sejong Daewang (1397-1450), reigned 1418-1450 as fourth king of Joseon or Chosun dynasty, in whose reign the hangeul alphabet was invented
